poem:
A Lesson in the Wild

In the quiet of Dublin's zoo,
mothers gather, lifting shirts,
an ancient ritual shared.
Their gentle rhythms
mimicked by eyes
behind the cage,
a bond teaching us, teaching them:
how both worlds merge
in the whisper of life—
human and ape.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Breastfeeding women try to show orangutan how to care for baby at Dublin zoo When staff at Dublin zoo discovered an orangutan named Mujur was pregnant they decided to stage maternal workshops. The 19-year-old female had not sufficiently bonded with either of her previous infants, who died in 2019 and 2022, so when she became pregnant earlier this year the zoo enlisted breastfeeding human mothers to try to show her how it was done. Lizzie". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Breastfeeding women try to show orangutan how to care for baby at Dublin zoo When staff at Dublin zoo discovered an orangutan named Mujur was pregnant they decided to stage maternal workshops. The 19-year-old female had not sufficiently bonded with either of her previous infants, who died in 2019 and 2022, so when she became pregnant earlier this year the zoo enlisted breastfeeding human mothers to try to show her how it was done. Lizzie
